Furthermore, a lazy person is like a pestle, with two kinds of things:
First, he cannot make himself work, and his body deteriorates day by day.
Second, he cannot stand on his own, and when discarded on the ground, he immediately lies down.
Gradually becoming unusable, he is burned by fire.

Lazy people are also like this. First, they do not drive themselves, and their physical strength decreases day by day. Second, they cannot diligently manage household affairs, always lying down and sleeping.
When the body perishes and life ends, they are burned in the fires of hell and experience suffering.

The person of diligence is like a wish-fulfilling tree. In the wilderness of birth and death, they become a place of refuge for all sentient beings. For those who are hungry and thirsty, they become food and drink. For those who are naked, they become clothing. They are able to deliver one from the dangers of birth and death, and for the duration of one's life, there is nothing lacking. They cause all sentient beings to be at ease and happy. Through the power of diligence, they are able to quickly accomplish supreme perfect enlightenment.
